title: 'dead after 4 years of usage'
body: 'Display quality is very good. But durability is low. Worked fine for 3 years without any problem. After 3 years some horizontal lines occurred on screen. still used it for 1 year. After completing 4 years its display gone. My average usage was 5-6 hrs daily.'

title: 'Nice for everyday use.'
body: 'You will have to tinker fair bit on the options for getting the optimal setting; however
column5: once you have locked on them
column6: the display works great. Like the slim and smooth design. The edges are not too thick. Great for everyday use
column7: including office and heavy programming. Not for gamers. Also the LG app that splits the screen in different formats is a power hog and can considerably slowdown your CPU

title: 'One of the best monitors for beginners on a budget'
body: 'After a calibrating the display was just simply amazing. Beautiful colour reproduction as well as decent viewing angles. Not gonna complain for a display on an 8k budget. Here are a few things to note: * The monitor caps at 1080P 75 Hz * sharpness is not great
column5: but also not so bad at the same time. * has only one HDMI input so please invest on an HDMI splitter. * The monitor has a 3.5mm port as well as ports for a VESA mount.'

title: 'Not so good'

title: 'Bought a dell monitor 2 years before this LG monitor and the dell still works while LG does not'
body: 'I bought a dell monitor in Oct 2018: https://www.amazon.in/gp/product/B07436JM87/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1  I bought this LG monitor in Jan 2020. It has stopped working in April 2023 while the Dell monitor is still going strong. When I say stopped working
column5: it is constantly flickering and has weird lines all over the screen. I believe that the Dell monitor was 4k cheaper. Taking that comparison into account
column6: I believe that this monitor has severely underdelivered in terms of how long it has lasted. In terms of picture quality
column7: both monitors were good enough for my use case. Perhaps the LG had marginally better picture quality than the Dell one but hard to tell and both anyway met my minimum requirement.'
